RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 1 7F Turf CR: 84. Claiming Purse 11000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 18 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000. (If necessary will be run SIX FURLONGS Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HARD N'SWEET advanced on the backside chasing to upper stretch vying late three deep getting up gamely. MR. MAGICO tracked a loose leader to the far turn rallying into upper stretch dueling late between horses battling to the end. JACK THE RIPPER (FR) well placed off a loose leader saved ground to upper stretch surging along the rail dueling to the wire. CORAL LEGACY raced evenly through the far turn gaining in the four path mid stretch threatening in the final yards. SUPPLY CHAIN raced evenly through the turn rallying down the lane closing the gap late. AREYOUTALKINGTOME raced mid pack needing a surge. THIRSTY ACTOR was never involved. FLYUNDERTHEGRAYDAR bored out badly into upper stretch. MAYOR REMO was always outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Jack the Ripper (FR)
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, saved ground, dueled late on rail, right there

ENTRY.NAME: Mayor Remo
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Flyunderthegraydar
ENTRY.COMMENT: bore out badly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Coral Legacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, 4 wide lane, threatened late

ENTRY.NAME: Hard n'Sweet
ENTRY.OWNER: Vickers Richard T and Pena Yendri J
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle move, vied to lane, dueled three deep, got up

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Magico
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, surged to lane, dueled gamely between foes

ENTRY.NAME: Areyoutalkingtome
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, no surge

ENTRY.NAME: Thirsty Actor
ENTRY.COMMENT: never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Supply Chain
ENTRY.OWNER: Bernardini Jay P Burnsworth Richard and Buyea Kristina
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, mid track lane, closed gap

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 2 7F Turf CR: 83. Claiming Purse 11000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 18 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000. (If necessary will be run SIX FURLONGS Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ESTILO VARONIL laid close up saving ground ground cutting the corner to grab a clear lead in upper stretch holding firm along the rail under a drive. RULING FRONT stalked the pace through the far turn vying in the five path upper stretch responding with a solid finish keeping the winner honest while saving place. SELLING OUT slow early lagged to upper stretch moving up late at mid track. BRIAR JUMPER raced mid pack angling six wide in upper stretch lacking a closing punch. WHISKEY SUNRISE slow early lagged to upper stretch passing a few there. PICCADILLY BEAU tracked the pace saving ground to upper stretch weakening there along the inside. REUX (GB) hustled to the front set the pace through the far turn being passed from the inside in upper stretch fading late. NIGHT BOSS played no factor. DYNAFORM trailed throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: Piccadilly Beau
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, weakened on the inside

ENTRY.NAME: Briar Jumper
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, angled 6 wide lane, lacked punch

ENTRY.NAME: Night Boss
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: played no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Ruling Front
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 5 wide upper stretch, solid finish, saved place

ENTRY.NAME: Selling Out
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, lagged to lane, moved up late mid track

ENTRY.NAME: Estilo Varonil
ENTRY.COMMENT: laid close up, cut corner to lane, cleared on rail, held driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Whiskey Sunrise
ENTRY.OWNER: Vickers Richard T and Pena Yendri J
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, lagged to lane, passed a few late

ENTRY.NAME: Dynaform
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Reux (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to top, set pace, passed lane, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 71. Allowance Purse 23800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JULY 18, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 18 Allowed 3 lbs. (Claiming Races For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Estimating Allowances) (Preference To Highest Earnings In 2022-2023).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GRACE ELIZABETH advanced steadily through the turn striking the lead in upper stretch drawing out as much the best. WHISKEY TALKING stalked early pressing to the lead on the turn being hooked into upper stretch proving a willing second best. ULTRA DIVA raced evenly throughout which was enough to best the others. HANDSOME JOANIE slow early proved no factor. SHEZAGOLDGETTER hustled along chased through the turn wearing out in upper stretch. OUT ONA LIMB led early being passed on the turn having nothing left in upper stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Grace Elizabeth
ENTRY.COMMENT: advanced steadily drawing even in upper stretch, moved off

ENTRY.NAME: Shezagoldgetter
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled along, chased to lane, wore out

ENTRY.NAME: Out Ona Limb
ENTRY.COMMENT: led early, ceded turn, used up

ENTRY.NAME: Handsome Joanie
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Ultra Diva
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, outbid others

ENTRY.NAME: Whiskey Talking
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, pressed turn, hooked lane, second best,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 8500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON THREE RACES SINCE JULY 18, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 18 Allowed 3 lbs. Claimi ng Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BAD KARMA prompted the pace wresting a short lead on the far turn widening in upper stretch being measured safely home. CHORIST slow early advanced quickly along the inside to the quarter pole swing out five wide in upper stretch closing the gap on an in hand winner at the wire. NATIVE VALLEY slow early lagged to upper stretch moving past the rest on the inside. FIANNA HILLS hustled out prompted the pace through the far turn ceding in upper stretch fading late. EGG NOG faded on the far turn. TALK DIRTY stalked the early pace tiring on the far turn. FLECK labored well back.

ENTRY.NAME: Fleck
ENTRY.COMMENT: labored well back

ENTRY.NAME: Chorist
ENTRY.OWNER: Stewart William G and Cellini Rob
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, rallied inside far turn, angled out lane, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Bad Karma
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace, led far turn, shook clear lane, held in hamd

ENTRY.NAME: Native Valley
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, lagged to lane, moved up inside

ENTRY.NAME: Fianna Hills
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled out, prompted pace, ceded to lane, tired,

ENTRY.NAME: Talk Dirty
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, faded far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Egg Nog
ENTRY.COMMENT: faded on the far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 5 1M Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Claiming Purse 7700. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RESVALON away alertly set the pace moving clear in upper stretch widening under a drive. MYSTIC MINISTER raced evenly through the backside rallying to threaten on the far turn being turned away in upper stretch holding on abreast rival to save place. FOGGY ALBION went evenly off the pace saving ground to upper stretch vying willingly late along the rail. WHY WINCHILL WHY slow early lagged to upper stretch mustering a mild gain there. TRUST FUND ROBBER raced evenly lacking more. FRANK THE BULL tracked the pace chasing on the far turn weakening in upper stretch. KEYSER was never involved. CAPTAIN BERNARDO chased through the far turn then wilted in upper stretch. PRESTON MURRAY folded up early.

ENTRY.NAME: Resvalon
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace, drew off top lane, widened driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Preston Murray
ENTRY.COMMENT: folded up early

ENTRY.NAME: Captain Bernardo
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, spent ;lane

ENTRY.NAME: Why Winchill Why
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, lagged tired, lane, gained some late

ENTRY.NAME: Keyser
ENTRY.COMMENT: never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Frank the Bull
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, chased far turn, weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Mystic Minister
ENTRY.OWNER: Quarter Pole Investments LLC and Fletcher Kevin
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, rallied far turn, chased to lane, no match, saved place

ENTRY.NAME: Foggy Albion
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, saved ground to lane, vied willingly along the rail

ENTRY.NAME: Trust Fund Robber
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, lacked more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 80. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 18800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile O r Over Since June 18 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Claiming Races For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Estimating Allowances)(W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KITTEN CALLS unhurried early gave a quick move emerging on the far turn hooking rival in upper stretch drawing off as much the best. POLYESTER BRIDE sent clear set the pace through the far turn being collared in upper stretch proving no match late holding as second best. GO STELLAIRE slow early swung out to upper stretch picking up the others from mid track. LADY NOGUEZ gave a modest middle move racing evenly from there as no threat. MAOILIN tracked the early pace fading on the far turn. CROSSTOWN GIRL was always outrun. MACHTENHAIRONFIRE chased the pace to the far turn then wilted abruptly in upper stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Crosstown Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Go Stellaire
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, swung out to lane, picked up rest 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Machtenhaironfire
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Maoilin
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, faded far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Noguez
ENTRY.OWNER: Tijuana Racing Stables Gordiano Racing Stable and Ayon Moreno Miguel
ENTRY.COMMENT: modest middle move, evenly lane, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Kitten Calls
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, quick move far turn, hooked foe lane, drew off,

ENTRY.NAME: Polyester Bride
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent clear, set pace, collared top lane, no match, second best,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 93. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 18800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 1 8 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Claiming Races For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Estimating Allowances)(W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HIGH ROLLING DUDE raced evenly to the far turn gaining there rallying to loom late dueling while carried out a bit getting up gamely. ESCAPE VELOCITY set the pace through the far turn digging in upper stretch angling out to meet rival late ceding grudgingly in the final strides. GOLDEN TONE slow early lost ground to upper stretch vying late seven wide. HEZA HANDFUL gained contention on the far turn saving ground to upper stretch hanging late along the rail. BACK ALLEY CAT slow early played no factor. ENJOY BASEBALL propped as the gate opened breaking late. SMASH prompted the early pace tiring on the far turn.

ENTRY.COMMENT: gained on the far turn, extended rail lane, hung

ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, gained far turn, dueled abreast late, carried out, got up

ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, dug in lane, hooked late, angled out, grugingly

ENTRY.NAME: Enjoy Baseball
ENTRY.COMMENT: propped broke late

ENTRY.NAME: Back Alley Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, played no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Smash
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Tone
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, lost ground to lane, vied late 7 wide,

FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON THREE RACES SINCE JULY 18, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 18 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HARD ASTRAY sent clear set the pace digging in down the lane holding under a drive. PEACE OF EKATI slow early raced through the far turn finding best stride late surging in the closing yards. SOLITAIRE GAME stalked the pace chasing to upper stretch hanging late. DEJOHN stalked the early pace fading on the far turn. TOMMY TUESDAY was never involved. PEPE TONO bobbled at the break, labored well back.
